page.title: 05TYNEMOUTH LOCAL HISTORY 2
page.content:
{Tynemouth Monastery and Priory }
There has been a monastery on the clifftop at Tynemouth since 627, but it did not become a centre of religion until the Benedictine monks rebuilt it in 1130 and it remained an important centre until the dissolution of the monasteries by King Henry VIII. The nave continued to be used as a parish church until 1688 but by this time most of the other buildings were falling into decay. Many of the buildings now have only their foundations remaining and the only part of the church to be completely preserved is the tine Percy Chapel added in 1450.
